timeline.bodyText: Not sure I understand the purpose of this interface. Can we remove it?
timeline.author: bogdandrutu
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -0,0 +1,44 @@ +/* + * Copyright 2020, OpenTelemetry Authors + * + * Licensed under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the "License"); + * you may not use this file except in compliance with the License. + * You may obtain a copy of the License at + * + * http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0 + * + * Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software + * distributed under the License is distributed on an "AS IS" BASIS, + * WITHOUT WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or implied. + * See the License for the specific language governing permissions and + * limitations under the License. + */ + +package io.opentelemetry.internal; + +import javax.annotation.concurrent.ThreadSafe; + +/** + * This interface allows the SDK to unobfuscate an obfuscated static global provider. + * + *

Static global providers are obfuscated when they are returned from the API to prevent users + * from casting them to their SDK specific implementation. + * + *

This is important for auto-instrumentation, because if users take the static global providers + * that are returned from the API, and cast them to their SDK specific implementations, then those + * casts will fail under auto-instrumentation, because auto-instrumentation takes over the static + * global providers returned by the API and points them to it's embedded SDK. + * + * @since 0.4.0 + */ +@ThreadSafe +public interface Obfuscated {

timeline.bodyText: Rather than Object, can we have this interface be parameterized with a type?
timeline.author: jkwatson
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -0,0 +1,44 @@ +/* + * Copyright 2020, OpenTelemetry Authors + * + * Licensed under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the "License"); + * you may not use this file except in compliance with the License. + * You may obtain a copy of the License at + * + * http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0 + * + * Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software + * distributed under the License is distributed on an "AS IS" BASIS, + * WITHOUT WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or implied. + * See the License for the specific language governing permissions and + * limitations under the License. + */ + +package io.opentelemetry.internal; + +import javax.annotation.concurrent.ThreadSafe; + +/** + * This interface allows the SDK to unobfuscate an obfuscated static global provider. + * + *

Static global providers are obfuscated when they are returned from the API to prevent users + * from casting them to their SDK specific implementation. + * + *

This is important for auto-instrumentation, because if users take the static global providers + * that are returned from the API, and cast them to their SDK specific implementations, then those + * casts will fail under auto-instrumentation, because auto-instrumentation takes over the static + * global providers returned by the API and points them to it's embedded SDK. + * + * @since 0.4.0 + */ +@ThreadSafe +public interface Obfuscated { + + /** + * Returns the unobfuscated provider. + * + * @return the unobfuscated provider. + * @since 0.4.0 + */ + Object unobfuscate();

replies.bodyText: @trask before doing this change, can we clarify why having this interface at all is necessary? Not saying to not obfuscate, I refer to the Obfuscated interface.
replies.author: bogdandrutu

replies.bodyText: @bogdandrutu just wanted to make sure that you saw my response #1152 (comment) (I should have replied here also)
replies.author: trask

timeline.bodyText: @bogdandrutu this is where the Obfuscated interface is used. OpenTelemetrySdk.getTracerProvider() needs some way to unwrap and retrieve the TracerSdkProvider. Did you have other idea how to unwrap?
timeline.author: trask
